Class ClientConfig

java.lang.Object
BaseConfig
ClientConfig
public class ClientConfig extends BaseConfig
Stores the client's configuration parameters for connecting to and interacting with the server.

Includes network settings, target file identifier, concurrency parameters, and behavior probabilities. Inherits common configuration options from BaseConfig.

  • Field Details

    • serverHost

      private String serverHost
      Hostname or IP address of the server to request files from.

    • serverPort

      private int serverPort
      Port of the server to connect to for file requests.

    • fileId

      private String fileId
      File ID to download from the server.

      If set to "random", a random file is selected from the server's resources. The file ID usually corresponds to the SHA-256 hash of the file.

    • dc

      private int dc
      Number of concurrent requests the client can make to download blocks.

    • pc

      private float pc
      Probability (between 0 and 1) that the client will deny a token request.

    • fromArgs

      public static ClientConfig fromArgs(String[] args)
      Parses command-line arguments in the format --key=value and returns a configured ClientConfig instance.

      Recognized keys:

      • port - client port (used to name the file directory)
      • serverHost - server address
      • serverPort - server port
      • file - file ID to request from the server
      • Dc - number of concurrent block requests
      • B - number of bytes per block request
      • Pc - probability of denying a token request

      The filesDirectory is automatically set to ../resources/ClientPort<port>.

      Parameters:
      args - command-line arguments
      Returns:
      a configured ClientConfig object

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representation of this configuration.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      a formatted string of all configuration values
